Detailed Description

Offers methods to use the Broyden-Fletcher-Goldfarb-Shanno algorithm for the optimization of models.

Given the error function , that shall be optimized, this function will be square approximated around the last given search point by

where is the Hessian matrix evaluated at with the entries

The derivation is then

At the optimum point holds , so the Newton step (the BFGS algorithm is a quasi-Newton method) is

The new search point is then directly determined from this step with this method used iteratively, because of the approximation.
The inverse Hessian matrix is iteratively estimated with possibility to restrict the number of iterations.

For a more detailed description of the BFGS algorithm refer to "Neural Networks for Pattern Recognition" by Christopher M. Bishop or "Numerical Recipes in C" by Press, Teukolsky, Vetterling and Flannery.

Author:
C. Igel
Date:
1999
Changes:
none
Status:
stable

Definition at line 149 of file BFGS.h.

Member Enumeration Documentation

enum BFGS::LineSearch

Used to specify the type of line search algorithm that is used by the BFGS algorithm:
"Linmin" is the original line search algorithm, "DLinmin" is a line search algorithm that additionally uses derivative information and "Cblnsrch" is a cubic line search.

Enumerator:
Dlinmin 
Linmin 
Cblnsrch 

Definition at line 158 of file BFGS.h.

Member Function Documentation

void BFGS::bfgs ( const Array< double > &  in,
const Array< double > &  target 
) [inline]

Updates the weights of the network by using the BFGS optimization algorithm, that was previously initialized.

The given input patterns in and their corresponding target values target are used to calculate the error of the currently used model. The resulting error function is then minimized by the BFGS algorithm, the weights of the network are updated.
This method needs far less parameters than the other BFGS method, because it is guessed, that one of the initBfgs methods was called before.

Parameters:
in Input patterns for the currently used model.
target Target values corresponding to the input patterns.
Returns:
none
Author:
C. Igel
Date:
1999
Changes
none
Status
stable

void BFGS::bfgs ( const Array< double > &  in,
const Array< double > &  target,
double &  fret 
)

Updates the weights of the network by using the BFGS optimization algorithm, that was previously initialized and returns the minimum value by reference.

The given input patterns in and their corresponding target values target are used to calculate the error of the currently used model. The resulting error function is then minimized by the BFGS algorithm, the weights of the network are updated.
This method needs far less parameters than the other BFGS method, because it is guessed, that one of the initBfgs methods was called before.

Parameters:
in Input patterns for the currently used model.
target Target values corresponding to the input patterns.
fret Minimum value of the error function.
Returns:
none

void BFGS::bfgs ( const Array< double > &  in,
const Array< double > &  target,
double  gtol,
unsigned &  iter,
double &  fret,
unsigned  iterMax 
)

Updates the weights of the network by using the BFGS optimization algorithm.

The given input patterns in and their corresponding target values target are used to calculate the error of the currently used model. The resulting error function is then minimized by the BFGS algorithm, the weights of the network are updated.

Parameters:
in Input patterns for the currently used model.
target Target values corresponding to the input patterns.
gtol Convergence requirement on zeoring the gradient.
iter Number of iterations that were performed by the function.
fret Minimum value of the error function.
iterMax Max. number of allowed iterations.
Returns:
none
Author:
C. Igel
Date:
1999

Referenced by bfgs().

void BFGS::initBfgs ( const Array< double > &  in,
const Array< double > &  target,
LineSearch  ls = Dlinmin,
double  ax = 0.,
double  bx = 1.,
double  lambda = 0.25 
) [inline]

Initializes some internal variables used by the BFGS algorithm.

The given parameters are used to initialize some variables used by the BFGS and the line search algorithms and to allocate memory for internal structures.

Parameters:
in Input patterns for the currently used model.
target Target values corresponding to the input patterns.
ls Type of LineSearch algorithm, that is used by the BFGS algorithm. Possible values: "Dlinmin" (default value), "Linmin", "Cblnsrch"
ax Initial left bracket for the line search algorithms, the default bracket is "0".
bx Initial right bracket for the line search algorithms, the default bracket is "1".
lambda The initial value for the searched , that will minimize the function used by the line search algorithm. The default value is "0.25".
Returns:
none
Author:
C. Igel
Date:
1999
Changes
none
Status
stable

References initBfgs().

void BFGS::initBfgs ( const Array< double > &  in,
const Array< double > &  target,
double &  fret,
LineSearch  ls = Dlinmin,
double  ax = 0.,
double  bx = 1.,
double  lambda = 0.25 
)

Initializes some internal variables used by the BFGS algorithm, calculates the current error of the model.

The given parameters are used to initialize some variables used by the BFGS and the line search algorithms and to allocate memory for internal structures. The current error value of the used model is determined.

Parameters:
in Input patterns for the currently used model.
target Target values corresponding to the input patterns.
fret Initial error of the currently used model.
ls Type of LineSearch algorithm, that is used by the BFGS algorithm. Possible values: "Dlinmin" (default value), "Linmin", "Cblnsrch"
ax Initial left bracket for the line search algorithms, the default bracket is "0".
bx Initial right bracket for the line search algorithms, the default bracket is "1".
lambda The initial value for the searched , that will minimize the function used by the line search algorithm. The default value is "0.25".
Returns:
none
Author:
C. Igel
Date:
1999
Changes
none
Status
stable

Definition at line 335 of file BFGS.cpp.

References ModelInterface::dedw.

void BFGS::setAx ( double  x  )  [inline]

Sets the initial value for the left bracket used by the line search algorithms.

The line search algorithms used by the BFGS algorithm searches for a minimum value of the error function along a search direction , i.e. it searches for a scalar , that minimizes

The minimum value searched is iteratively bracketed by two points. The left point (i.e. the value that is less than the minimum) can be set by this method.

Parameters:
x The initial value for the left bracket.
Returns:
none
Author:
C. Igel
Date:
1999
Changes
none
Status
stable

Sets the initial value for the right bracket used by the line search algorithms.

The line search algorithms used by the BFGS algorithm searches for a minimum value of the error function along a search direction , i.e. it searches for a scalar , that minimizes

The minimum value searched is iteratively bracketed by two points. The right point (i.e. the value that is greater than the minimum) can be set by this method.

Parameters:
x The initial value for the right bracket.
